column4: i686-smp kernel image has been replaced by the 686 generic image?

i think
it might be a module
no, it's highlighting. it get your attention

nope

i cant remember how it works, but i think so
initrd is for if you have a ramdisk, i think
if you dont have a ramdisk there is no point in having it

it is in debian
can you recommend a reference on initrd so that i can better understand it?
